Class CouchbaseClient

railo-context.Component

Constructor Detail

init

public init([any config='[runtime expression]'])
Constructor This creates a connection to a Couchbase server using the passed in config argument, which can be a struct literal of options, a path to a config object or an instance of a cfcouchbase.config.CouchbaseConfig object. For all the possible config settings, look at the CouchbaseConfig object.

Parameters:
config - The configuration structure, config object or path to a config object.

Method Detail

add

public any add(string ID, any value, [numeric timeout], [any persistTo], [any replicateTo])
This method is the same as set(), except the future that is returned will return true if the ID being set doesn't already exist. The future will return false if the item being set does already exist. It will not throw an error if the ID already exists, you must check the future. This function returns a Java OperationFuture object (net.spy.memcached.internal.OperationFuture) or void (null) if a timeout exception occurs.

Parameters:
ID - true
value - true
timeout - The expiration of the document in minutes, by default it is 0, so it lives forever
persistTo - The number of nodes that need to store the document to disk before this call returns. Use the this.peristTo enum on this object for values [ ZERO, MASTER, ONE, TWO, THREE ]
replicateTo - The number of nodes to replicate the document to before this call returns. Use the this.replicateTo enum on this object for values [ ZERO, ONE, TWO, THREE ]

append

public any append(string ID, any value, [numeric CAS])
Append to an existing value in the cache. If 0 is passed in as the CAS identifier (default), it will override the value on the server without performing the CAS check. Note that the return will be false any time a mutation has not occurred from the Future returned object. This method is considered a 'binary' method since they operate on binary data such as string or integers, not JSON documents

Parameters:
ID - The unique id of the document whose value will be appended
value - The value to append
CAS - CAS identifier (ignored in the ascii protocol)

asyncDecr

public any asyncDecr(string ID, numeric value)
Decrement the given counter asynchronously,a future with the decremented value, or -1 if the decrement failed.

Parameters:
ID - The id of the document to decrement
value - The amount to decrement

asyncGet

public any asyncGet(string ID)
Get an object from couchbase asynchronously, returns a Java Future object

Parameters:
ID - The ID of the document to retrieve.

asyncGetAndTouch

public any asyncGetAndTouch(string ID, numeric timeout)
Obtain a value for a given ID and update the expiry time for the document at the same time. This is useful for a sort of "last access timeout" functionality where you don't want a document to timeout while it is still being accessed. This method will return a Future object that retrieves a CASValue class that you can use to get the value and cas of the object.

Parameters:
ID - The ID of the document to retrieve.
timeout - The expiration of the document in minutes

asyncGetMulti

public any asyncGetMulti(array ID)
Get multiple objects from couchbase asynchronously. Returns a bulk Java Future. Any document IDs not found will not exist in the struct.

Parameters:
ID - An array of document IDs to retrieve.

asyncGetWithCAS

public any asyncGetWithCAS(string ID)
Gets (with CAS support) the given key asynchronously. Returns a Java Future. This method is meant to be used in conjunction with setWithCAS to be able to update a document while making sure another process hasn't modified it in the meantime. The CAS value changes every time the document is updated. The future has methods that will return the "CAS" and "value" keys.

Parameters:
ID - The ID of the document to retrieve.

asyncIncr

public any asyncIncr(string ID, numeric value)
Increment the given counter asynchronously,a future with the incremented value, or -1 if the increment failed.

Parameters:
ID - The id of the document to decrement
value - The amount to decrement

Parameters:
config

buildDataMarshaller

private any buildDataMarshaller(any config)
Build the data marshaller

Parameters:
config

decr

public any decr(string ID, numeric value, [numeric defaultValue='0'], [numeric timeout])
Decrement the given counter, returning the new value. Due to the way the memcached server operates on items, incremented and decremented items will be returned as Strings with any operations that return a value. This function returns the new value, or -1 if we were unable to decrement or add

Parameters:
ID - The id of the document to decrement
value - The amount to decrement
defaultValue - The default value ( if the counter does not exist, this defaults to 0 );
timeout - The expiration of the document in minutes, by default it is 0, so it lives forever

defaultPersistReplicate

private CouchbaseClient defaultPersistReplicate(any args)
Default persist and replicate from arguments

Parameters:
args

delete

public any delete(any ID, [any persistTo], [any replicateTo])
Delete a value with durability options. The durability options here operate similarly to those documented in the set method. This function returns a Java OperationFuture object (net.spy.memcached.internal.OperationFuture) or a struct of futures

Parameters:
ID - The ID of the document to delete, or an array of ID's to delete
persistTo - The number of nodes that need to store the document to disk before this call returns. Use the this.peristTo enum on this object for values [ ZERO, MASTER, ONE, TWO, THREE ]
replicateTo - The number of nodes to replicate the document to before this call returns. Use the this.replicateTo enum on this object for values [ ZERO, ONE, TWO, THREE ]

deserializeData

public any deserializeData(string data, [any inflateTo=''], [boolean deserialize='true'])
This method deserializes an incoming data string via JSON and according to our rules. It can also accept an optional inflateTo parameter wich can be an object we should inflate our data to.

Parameters:
data - A JSON document to deserialize according to our rules
inflateTo - The object that will be used to inflate the data with according to our conventions
deserialize - The boolean value that marks if we should deserialize or not. Default is true

flush

public any flush([numeric delay='0'])
Flush all caches from all servers with a delay of application. Returns a future object

Parameters:
delay - The period of time to delay, in seconds

get

public any get(string ID, [boolean deserialize='true'], [any inflateTo=''])
Get an object from couchbase, returns null if not found.

Parameters:
ID - The ID of the document to retrieve.
deserialize - Deserialize the JSON automatically for you and return the representation
inflateTo - The object that will be used to inflate the data with according to our conventions

getAndTouch

public any getAndTouch(string ID, numeric timeout, [boolean deserialize='true'], [any inflateTo=''])
Obtain a value for a given ID and update the expiry time for the document at the same time. This is useful for a sort of "last access timeout" functionality where you don't want a document to timeout while it is still being accessed. This method will return a struct with "CAS" and "value" keys. If the ID doesn't exist, this method will return null.

Parameters:
ID - The ID of the document to retrieve.
timeout - The expiration of the document in minutes
deserialize - Deserialize the JSON automatically for you and return the representation
inflateTo - The object that will be used to inflate the data with according to our conventions

Parameters:
ID - An array of document IDs to retrieve.
deserialize - Deserialize the JSON automatically for you and return the representation
inflateTo - The object that will be used to inflate the data with according to our conventions

getQuery

public any getQuery([struct options='[runtime expression]'])
Gets a new Java Couchbase query class object (com.couchbase.client.protocol.views.Query) that can be used to execute raw view queries. You can pass an optional options struct with name-value pairs of simple query options like: debug:boolean, descending:boolean, endKeyDocID:string, group:boolean, groupLevel:numeric, etc. http://www.couchbase.com/autodocs/couchbase-java-client-1.2.0/com/couchbase/client/protocol/views/Query.html

Parameters:
options - A struct of query options, see http://www.couchbase.com/autodocs/couchbase-java-client-1.2.0/com/couchbase/client/protocol/views/Query.html for more information. This only does the simple 1 value options

getSDKVersion

public string getSDKVersion()
get: The version of the Couchbase SDK

getSpatialView

public any getSpatialView(string designDocument, string name)
Gets access to a spatial view contained in a design document from the cluster by returning a View Java object (com.couchbase.client.protocol.views.SpatialView). You would usually use this method if you need the raw Java object to do manual queries or updates on a view.

Parameters:
designDocument - The name of the design document
name - The name of the view to get

getStats

public any getStats([string stat])
Get all of the stats from all of the connections, each key of the returned struct is a java java.net.InetSocketAddress object

Parameters:
stat - The key of an individual stat to return

getUuidHelper

public string getUuidHelper()

getVersion

public string getVersion()
get: The version of this library

getView

public any getView(string designDocument, string name)
Gets access to a view contained in a design document from the cluster by returning a View Java object (com.couchbase.client.protocol.views.View). You would usually use this method if you need the raw Java object to do manual queries or updates on a view.

Parameters:
designDocument - The name of the design document
name - The name of the view to get

getWithCAS

public any getWithCAS(string ID, [boolean deserialize='true'], [any inflateTo=''])
Get an object from couchbase with its CAS value, returns null if not found. This method is meant to be used in conjunction with setWithCAS to be able to update a document while making sure another process hasn't modified it in the meantime. The CAS value changes every time the document is updated. This method will return a struct with "CAS" and "value" keys. If the ID doesn't exist, this method will return null.

Parameters:
ID - The ID of the document to retrieve.
deserialize - Deserialize the JSON automatically for you and return the representation
inflateTo - The object that will be used to inflate the data with according to our conventions

incr

public any incr(string ID, numeric value, [numeric defaultValue='0'], [numeric timeout])
Increment the given counter, returning the new value. Due to the way the memcached server operates on items, incremented and decremented items will be returned as Strings with any operations that return a value. This function returns the new value, or -1 if we were unable to increment or add

Parameters:
ID - The id of the document to increment
value - The amount to increment
defaultValue - The default value ( if the counter does not exist, this defaults to 0 );
timeout - The expiration of the document in minutes, by default it is 0, so it lives forever

loadSDK

private any loadSDK()
Load JavaLoader with the SDK

prepend

public any prepend(string ID, any value, [numeric CAS])
Prepend to an existing value in the cache. If 0 is passed in as the CAS identifier (default), it will override the value on the server without performing the CAS check. Note that the return will be false any time a mutation has not occurred from the Future returned object. This method is considered a 'binary' method since they operate on binary data such as string or integers, not JSON documents

Parameters:
ID - The unique id of the document whose value will be prepended
value - The value to prepend
CAS - CAS identifier (ignored in the ascii protocol)

query

public any query(string designDocument, string view, [any options='[runtime expression]'], [boolean deserialize='true'], [any inflateTo=''], [any filter], [any transform])
Queries a Couchbase view and returns a CFML struct of structs representation. Each row contains the following items: id, document The options struct maps to the set of options found in the native Couchbase query object (com.couchbase.client.protocol.views.Query) See http://www.couchbase.com/autodocs/couchbase-java-client-1.2.0/com/couchbase/client/protocol/views/Query.html

Parameters:
designDocument - The name of the design document
view - The name of the view to get
options - The query options to use for this query. This can be a structure of name-value pairs or an actual Couchbase query options object usually using the 'getQuery()' method.
deserialize - If true, it will deserialize the documents if they are valid JSON, else they are ignored.
inflateTo
filter - A closure or UDF that must return boolean to use to filter out results from the returning array of records, the closure receives a struct that has an id and the document: function( row ). A true does not add the row to the final results.
transform - A closure or UDF to use to transform records from the returning array of records, the closure receives a struct that has an id and the document: function( row ). Since the struct is by reference, you do not need to return anything.

rawQuery

public any rawQuery(any view, any query)
Queries a Couchbase view and returns a raw Java View result object. The result can be accessed row-wise via an iterator class (com.couchbase.client.protocol.views.ViewResponse). See: http://www.couchbase.com/autodocs/couchbase-java-client-1.2.0/com/couchbase/client/protocol/views/ViewResponse.html

Parameters:
view - A couchbase view object (com.couchbase.client.protocol.views.View)
query - A couchbase query object (com.couchbase.client.protocol.views.Query)

replace

public any replace(string ID, any value, [numeric timeout], [any persistTo], [any replicateTo])
This method will set a value only if that ID already exists in Couchbase. If the document ID doesn't exist, it will do nothing. This function returns a Java OperationFuture object (net.spy.memcached.internal.OperationFuture) or void (null) if a timeout exception occurs. future.get() will return true if the replace was successfull, and will return false if the ID didn't already exist to replace.

Parameters:
ID - The ID of the document to replace.
value - The value of the document to replace
timeout - The expiration of the document in minutes, by default it is 0, so it lives forever
persistTo - The number of nodes that need to store the document to disk before this call returns. Use the this.peristTo enum on this object for values [ ZERO, MASTER, ONE, TWO, THREE ]
replicateTo - The number of nodes to replicate the document to before this call returns. Use the this.replicateTo enum on this object for values [ ZERO, ONE, TWO, THREE ]

serializeData

public string serializeData(any data)
This method serializes incoming data according to our rules and it returns a string representation usually JSON

Parameters:
data - The data to serialize

set

public any set(string ID, any value, [numeric timeout], [any persistTo], [any replicateTo])
Set a value with durability options. It is asyncronouse by default so it returns immediatley without waiting for the actual set to complete. Call future.set() if you need to confirm the document has been set. Even then, the document is only guarunteed to be in memory on a single node. To force the document to be replicated to additional nodes, pass the replicateTo argument. A value of ReplicateTo.TWO ensures the document is copied to at least two replica nodes, etc. (This assumes you have replicas enabled) To force the document to be perisited to disk, passing in PersistTo.ONE ensures it is stored on disk in a single node. PersistTo.TWO ensures 2 nodes, etc. A PersistTo.TWO durability setting implies a replication to at least one node. This function returns a Java OperationFuture object (net.spy.memcached.internal.OperationFuture) or void (null) if a timeout exception occurs.

Parameters:
ID - The unique id of the document to store
value - The value to store
timeout - The expiration of the document in minutes, by default it is 0, so it lives forever
persistTo - The number of nodes that need to store the document to disk before this call returns. Use the this.peristTo enum on this object for values [ ZERO, MASTER, ONE, TWO, THREE ]
replicateTo - The number of nodes to replicate the document to before this call returns. Use the this.replicateTo enum on this object for values [ ZERO, ONE, TWO, THREE ]

setCouchbaseClient

public any setCouchbaseClient(any couchbaseClient)
set: The java CouchbaseClient object

Parameters:
couchbaseClient

setLibID

set: The unique ID of this SDK

Parameters:
libID

setMulti

public any setMulti(struct data, [numeric timeout], [any persistTo], [any replicateTo])
Set multiple documents in the cache with a single operation. Pass in a struct of documents to set where the IDs of the struct are the document IDs. The values in the struct are the values being set. All documents share the same timout, persistTo, and replicateTo settings. This function returns a struct of IDs with each of the future objects from the set operations. There will be no future object if a timeout occurs.

Parameters:
data - A struct (key/value pair) of documents to set into Couchbase.
timeout - The expiration of the documents in minutes.
persistTo - The number of nodes that need to store the document to disk before this call returns. Use the this.peristTo enum on this object for values [ ZERO, MASTER, ONE, TWO, THREE ]
replicateTo - The number of nodes to replicate the document to before this call returns. Use the this.replicateTo enum on this object for values [ ZERO, ONE, TWO, THREE ]

setSDKVersion

public any setSDKVersion(any SDKVersion)
set: The version of the Couchbase SDK

Parameters:
SDKVersion

public any setUtil(any util)
set: The SDK utility class

Parameters:
util

set: The UUID Helper

Parameters:
uuidHelper

setVersion

public any setVersion(any version)
set: The version of this library

Parameters:
version

setWithCAS

public any setWithCAS(string ID, any value, string CAS, [numeric timeout], [any persistTo], [any replicateTo])
Update the value of an existing document with a CAS value. CAS is retrieved via getWithCAS(). Since the CAS value changes every time a document is modified you will be able to tell if another process has modified the document between the time you retrieved it and updated it. This method will only complete successfully if the original document value is unchanged. This method is not asyncronous and therefore does not return a future since your application code will need to check the return and handle it appropriatley. This method returns a struct with a status and detail key. Status will be true if the document was succesfully updated. If status is false, that means nothing happened on the server and you need to re-issue a command to store your document. When status is false, check the detail. A value of "CAS_CHANGED" indicates that anothe rprocess has updated the document and your version is out-of-date. You will need to retrieve the document again with getWithCAS() and attempt your setWithCAS again. If status is false and details is "NOT_FOUND", that means a document with that ID was not found. You can then issue an add() or a regular set() commend to store the document.

Parameters:
ID - The unique id of the document to store
value - The value to store
CAS - CAS value retrieved via getWithCAS()
timeout - The expiration of the document in minutes, by default it is 0, so it lives forever
persistTo - The number of nodes that need to store the document to disk before this call returns. Use the this.peristTo enum on this object for values [ ZERO, MASTER, ONE, TWO, THREE ]
replicateTo - The number of nodes to replicate the document to before this call returns. Use the this.replicateTo enum on this object for values [ ZERO, ONE, TWO, THREE ]

shutdown

public CouchbaseClient shutdown([numeric timeout='10'])
Shutdown the native client connection

Parameters:
timeout - The timeout in seconds, we default to 10 seconds

touch

public any touch(string ID, numeric timeout)
Touch the given key to reset its expiration time. This method returns a future

Parameters:
ID - The id of the document to increment
timeout - The expiration of the document in minutes

validateConfig

private any validateConfig(any config)
Standardize and validate configuration object

Parameters:
config - The config options as a struct, path or instance.
